content.description: Climbs the southwest arete on beautiful varnish. Jump start to the obvious sloper, move left into a great undercling, and work straight up through sloping crimps to a sloped varnish topout. AKA Special K
Variation On Vino Rojo. Exactly the same, except on the top out, flail and hump your way to the right side of the arete. Slide down to the start hold, and then hop/ mantle to the top of the boulder.
content.location: Variation On Vino Rojo. Exactly the same, except on the top out, flail and hump your way to the right side of the arete. Slide down to the start hold, and then hop/ mantle to the top of the boulder.null

content.description: Long and sustained with interesting movement. Start on the far left incut jug and traverse right on low holds. After turning the arete, join or stay slightly left of a V1 highball topout line.
content.protection: Crash-pad and maybe a spotter for the high topout.

content.description: Starts on a super nice righthand jug, then crimps going straight up to the top. Short route, nothing fancy. Might be a little hard getting down.
content.location: Located on the left edge of the east face of Hot Tub Club.

content.description: Crouch start with a large angled jug in the middle of the wall and climb towards the ledges and top out
content.location: Downclimb is the same route. A little spicy but not bad

content.description: Big K stand starts immediately below the start hold of Vino Rojo. Left hand on a sidepull/undercling crimp and your right hand on a slopy crimp on the arete. Make a big move to the start hold of Vino Rojo and finish up on that problem. Very hard one move wonder with great moves to boot on Vino Rojo.
Stand start with a righthand side pull and go straight up the varnished wall on marginal holds.
content.location: Find the chalked up crimp face a few routes left of Vino Rojo.

content.description: Start as for Orange Top Blue Sky on the far left of the east side of the boulder.  Instead of staying low, head toward the undercling jug on Blackstone.  From there top out as for Blackstone.
content.location: Starts on the left side of the east face of the boulder.

content.description: Huge boulder with the well-chalked (difficult) traverse on the east side and a handful of problems on the other sides.
